channel.title: Food Healing Help

item.title: Food Healing Help
item.dc:creator: @sickpk sickpk
item.description:
@sickpk wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:11, topic:232587”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=306747.msg2453178#msg2453178 date=1222059468]

healing[1] = 20; healing[2] = 20; healing[3] = -1;

Try making healing[1] and healing[2] to exact same number.

Edit: Got beat to it, but there is also another way to fix this in your healing boolean.

[/quote]
Wow, I beat Rich to it?
Damn…[/quote]
It worked, thanks, rep for you tony, soz i can’t rep u rich lol

Read full topic

item.title: Food Healing Help
item.dc:creator: @sickpk sickpk
item.description:
@sickpk wrote:

it is at 16 i think, this is what it says right now

break;
case 6685: //Sara brew (4)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 16;
healing[2] = 26;
healing[3] = 6687;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;
case 6687: //Sara brew (3)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 16;
healing[2] = 26;
healing[3] = 6689;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;
case 6689: //Sara brew (2)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 16;
healing[2] = 26;
healing[3] = 6691;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;
case 6691: //Sara brew (1)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 16;
healing[2] = 26;
healing[3] = 229;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;

Read full topic

item.title: Food Healing Help
item.dc:creator: @sickpk sickpk
item.description:
@sickpk wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:5, topic:232587”]Well 2 is like nothing at all… 3 is just the ID that when its done.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2008, 10:52:06 pm[/size][hr][quote author=`Rich link=topic=306747.msg2453168#msg2453168 date=1222059053]
Healing[2] is basically worthless, healing[3] is the item ID it is adding to your inventory once it is finished healing, such as potions.
[/quote]
Darn you…[/quote]
i think something didnt work right, the dose’s dont heal the same, one dose healed 20

item.title: Food Healing Help
item.dc:creator: @sickpk sickpk
item.description:
@sickpk wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:2, topic:232587”]Heres the code for 16 a dose.

break; case 6685: //Sara brew (4) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 6687; actionTimer = 3; } break; case 6687: //Sara brew (3) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 6689; actionTimer = 3; } break; case 6689: //Sara brew (2) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 6691; actionTimer = 3; } break; case 6691: //Sara brew (1) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 229; actionTimer = 3; } break;

This worked on my source so It should work anywhere.[/quote]
thanks, it worked but how do u figger out the hp for healing 2 and 3?

Read full topic

item.title: Food Healing Help
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Heres the code for 16 a dose.

break; case 6685: //Sara brew (4) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 6687; actionTimer = 3; } break; case 6687: //Sara brew (3) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 6689; actionTimer = 3; } break; case 6689: //Sara brew (2) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 6691; actionTimer = 3; } break; case 6691: //Sara brew (1) if (actionTimer == 0) { healing[1] = 16; healing[2] = 26; healing[3] = 229; actionTimer = 3; } break;

This worked on my source so It should work anywhere.

item.title: Food Healing Help
item.dc:creator: @sickpk sickpk
item.description:
@sickpk wrote:

Well i want to make sara brews heal 16 insted of 10 per dose, but if i change healing 1 do i have to change healing 2? and if so what do i make healing 2?, do i leave it the same?

case 6685: //Sara brew (4)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 10;
healing[2] = 20;
healing[3] = 6687;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;
case 6687: //Sara brew (3)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 10;
healing[2] = 20;
healing[3] = 6689;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;
case 6689: //Sara brew (2)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 10;
healing[2] = 20;
healing[3] = 6691;
actionTimer = 2;
}
break;
case 6691: //Sara brew (1)
if (actionTimer == 0) {
healing[1] = 10;
healing[2] = 20;
healing[3] = 229;
actionTimer = 2;
}

Read full topic
